p: Aliquots from a microdilution plate (of MIC assay) were transferred to a Petri dish containing Sabouraud Dextrose agar or Müller Hinton agar to the fungicidal and bactericidal activities, respectively. The plates were incubated at 35°C for 48 h for Candida sp. and 72 h for Cryptococcus sp. and Rhodotorula sp. and at 37°C for 24 h for bacteria. The MFC and MBC were defined as the lowest concentration capable of inhibiting colony growth [ 46].
